item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

moparisthebest:

I tried this a few months ago, unfortunatly though it looks like your logging in succesfully, you never get past the “loading please wait” screen and noone ever sees you in the game, it was a good try though

well could you still fight someone in game?

that would be so funny,

sorry you died to a banned guy.

item.title: Ok i found something that i think might be usefull
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

nathan:

well doesnt the client send the packet to the server to determine wether or not to let it log in?

No, you’ve got it backwards
The server receives the login data, decides if the session is valid, then tells the client what to do. Even if the client somehow ignored a disconnect and kept the connection, what good would a session the server had stopped acknowledging be?

Read full topic

item.title: Ok i found something that i think might be usefull
item.dc:creator: @nathan nathan
item.description:
@nathan wrote:

i was messing around looking through client.java and found this

if(k == 1) Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.90000000000000002D, 250); if(k == 2) Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.80000000000000004D, 250); if(k == 3) Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.69999999999999996D, 250); if(k == 4) Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.59999999999999998D, 250); ItemDef.aClass41_278.method555(); aBoolean807 = true;

now if you changed the k==4 which is the ban packet to k == 1 which is the succeful login like this

[code][ if(k == 1)
Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.90000000000000002D, 250);
if(k == 2)
Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.80000000000000004D, 250);
if(k == 3)
Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.69999999999999996D, 250);
if(k == 4)
Class6_Sub3_Sub1_Sub1.method192(0.90000000000000002D, 250);
ItemDef.aClass41_278.method555();
aBoolean807 = true;/code]

and then i found some more

if(k == 1) { method114(-400, aBoolean1122, true); aBoolean1122 = true; } if(k == 2) { method114(-800, aBoolean1122, true); aBoolean1122 = true; } if(k == 3) { method114(-1200, aBoolean1122, true); aBoolean1122 = true; } if(k == 4) aBoolean1122 = false; if(aBoolean1122 != flag1 && !aBoolean872) {
and then change the k == 4 to the k == 1

then i found even more

if(k == 1) { aBoolean936 = true; method81(-400, false); } if(k == 2) { aBoolean936 = true; method81(-800, false); } if(k == 3) { aBoolean936 = true; method81(-1200, false); } if(k == 4) aBoolean936 = false;

so wouldnt that make it so if you were banned it would log you in any ways becuz your changing all the banned to the login?
[/code]

Read full topic
